summary: As of Sept. 30, 2019, the federal debt was $22.7 trillion. Treasury’s Fiscal Service borrows the money needed to operate the federal government. It reports the debt in a financial statement called the Schedule of Federal Debt. Each year, we audit and issue an opinion on the Schedules of Federal Debt and the effectiveness of related internal controls (e.g., ability to ensure that transactions are...
title: Financial Audit: Bureau of the Fiscal Service's FY 2019 and FY 2018 Schedules of Federal Debt
